page.title: 08MORESBY-KEEKLE OPENCAST 1.
page.content: The area of the Moresby-Keekle open cast site now being worked is an old mine which was worked by the monks of High Wreay many years ago.The National Coal Board are in overall charge of the site though the work is contracted out. The site employs 120 manual workers and 20 administrative staff. When recuiting workers preferential treament is given to those who have at one time been employed in a conventional mine.All personnel must wear helmets and fluorescent safety jackets whenever they enter the site.This also applies to poeple riding round the site in land rovers or lorries.An open cast site is less expesive to run than an underground mine.It is much quicker to get the coal from the open cast where the seams of coal are more accessible.
